verses.kjv: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,
verses.ct: Then Bildad the Shuhite responded:

verses.kjv: How long will it be ere ye make an end of words? mark, and afterwards we will speak.
verses.ct: "How long before you stop talking? Think carefully, and then we can have a real conversation."

verses.kjv: Wherefore are we counted as beasts, and reputed vile in your sight?
verses.ct: "Why do you treat us like animals? Why do you consider us stupid?"

verses.kjv: He teareth himself in his anger: shall the earth be forsaken for thee? and shall the rock be removed out of his place?
verses.ct: "You tear yourself apart with your own rage. Should the earth be abandoned just for your sake? Should mountains be moved to accommodate you?"

verses.kjv: Yea, the light of the wicked shall be put out, and the spark of his fire shall not shine.
verses.ct: "The lamp of the wicked will be snuffed out, and the flame of their fire will stop giving light."

verses.kjv: The light shall be dark in his tabernacle, and his candle shall be put out with him.
verses.ct: "The light inside their tent will grow dim, and their lamp above them will be extinguished."

verses.kjv: The steps of his strength shall be straitened, and his own counsel shall cast him down.
verses.ct: "Their confident stride will be cut short, and their own schemes will bring them down."

verses.kjv: For he is cast into a net by his own feet, and he walketh upon a snare.
verses.ct: "Their own feet lead them into a net; they walk right over a trap."

verses.kjv: The gin shall take him by the heel, and the robber shall prevail against him.
verses.ct: "A snare catches them by the ankle, and a noose tightens around them."

verses.kjv: The snare is laid for him in the ground, and a trap for him in the way.
verses.ct: "A rope lies hidden for them on the ground, and a trap waits for them along the path."

verses.kjv: Terrors shall make him afraid on every side, and shall drive him to his feet.
verses.ct: "Terrors surround them from every direction and chase them at every step."

verses.kjv: His strength shall be hungerbitten, and destruction shall be ready at his side.
verses.ct: "Disaster is hungry for them, and ruin stands ready at their side."

verses.kjv: It shall devour the strength of his skin: even the firstborn of death shall devour his strength.
verses.ct: "Disease eats away at their skin; death's most deadly plague consumes their body."

verses.kjv: His confidence shall be rooted out of his tabernacle, and it shall bring him to the king of terrors.
verses.ct: "They are torn from the security of their tent and marched off to the king of terrors."

verses.kjv: It shall dwell in his tabernacle, because it is none of his: brimstone shall be scattered upon his habitation.
verses.ct: "Something not their own will occupy their tent; burning sulfur will be scattered over their home."

verses.kjv: His roots shall be dried up beneath, and above shall his branch be cut off.
verses.ct: "Below, their roots dry up, and above, their branches wither away."

verses.kjv: His remembrance shall perish from the earth, and he shall have no name in the street.
verses.ct: "All memory of them will vanish from the earth; no one anywhere will remember their name."

verses.kjv: He shall be driven from light into darkness, and chased out of the world.
verses.ct: "They will be pushed from light into darkness, driven out of the world entirely."

verses.kjv: He shall neither have son nor nephew among his people, nor any remaining in his dwellings.
verses.ct: "They will have no children or grandchildren among their people, no survivor left where they once lived."

verses.kjv: They that come after him shall be astonied at his day, as they that went before were affrighted.
verses.ct: "Future generations will be horrified by what happened to them, just as those who witnessed it were filled with dread."

verses.kjv: Surely such are the dwellings of the wicked, and this is the place of him that knoweth not God.
verses.ct: "This is certainly the fate of the wicked â€” this is what happens to those who do not know God."
